summary: The Pacific Ready Coast Guard Act (H.R. 3397) focuses on bolstering U.S. Coast Guard presence and capabilities in the Indo-Pacific region. The bill mandates the establishment of a Center of Expertise in Indo-Pacific Maritime Governance. It requires the Commandant to create an annual plan and budget display for Coast Guard operations in the Pacific. Furthermore, the act calls for reports on the feasibility of a standing maritime group, forward operating bases, and Coast Guard attachés in the region. The goal of the bill is to strengthen maritime governance, support Department of State/Defense missions, and enhance U.S. influence in the Indo-Pacific.
